item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, December 13, 2024 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: I designed an espresso machine and coffee grinder (85 points | 29 comments)
2. A new video captures a 1968 demo of IBM’s Executive Terminal (153 points | 25 comments)
3. The age of average (2023) (61 points | 24 comments)
4. A transformer supply crisis bottlenecks energy projects (47 points | 37 comments)
5. Fixing the Loading in Myst IV: Revelation (67 points | 7 comments)
6. Elixir/Erlang Hot Swapping Code (2016) (143 points | 64 comments)
7. Clio: A system for privacy-preserving insights into real-world AI use (41 points | 13 comments)
8. Mathematicians uncover a new way to count prime numbers (52 points | 22 comments)
9. Microsoft GW-Basic User's Guide and Reference (1989) [pdf] (22 points | 10 comments)
10. Taming LLMs – A Practical Guide to LLM Pitfalls with Open Source Software (106 points | 17 comments)
11. What every systems programmer should know about concurrency (2020) [pdf] (30 points | 3 comments)
12. Amid cuts to basic research, New Zealand scraps all support for social sciences (17 points | 6 comments)
13. Timemap.org – Interactive Map of History (869 points | 136 comments)
14. Why do animals adopt? (10 points | 2 comments)
15. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it's going (304 points | 137 comments)
16. Librebooting the ThinkPad T480 (16 points | 9 comments)
17. Gukesh becomes the youngest chess world champion in history (954 points | 390 comments)
18. Unexpected Keyboard (179 points | 85 comments)
19. Assisted dying now accounts for one in 20 Canada deaths (410 points | 698 comments)
20. Rust's Incremental Compiler Architecture (40 points | 5 comments)
21. Scrabble star wins Spanish world title despite not speaking Spanish (86 points | 65 comments)
22. A new timeline for Neanderthal interbreeding with modern humans (52 points | 29 comments)
23. The secret life of DNS packets (2019) (51 points | 7 comments)
24. When the future arrived, it felt ordinary (9 points | 2 comments)
25. A room temperature Li2O-based lithium-air battery enabled by a solid electrolyte (87 points | 39 comments)
26. Converting untrusted PDFs into trusted ones: The Qubes Way (2013) (93 points | 33 comments)
27. Show HN: Lfi – a lazy functional sync, async, and concurrent iteration library (72 points | 18 comments)
28. Bitbanging 1D Reversible Automata (71 points | 14 comments)
29. Trinity Desktop Environment (TDE) (64 points | 24 comments)
30. Saving Voyager 1 [video] (3 points | 1 comment)
